did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: R. Keith Dennis Mathematician Print and Photo collection, circa 1850-1950.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection consists namely of prints, portraits and photographs of mathematicians.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: R. Keith Dennis is a Professor of Mathematics at Cornell University with a focus area on commutative and non-commutative algebra, algebraic K-theory, group theory, and mathematical bibliography.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection consists namely of prints, portraits and photographs of mathematicians colelcted by Dennis. Notable historic figures in mathematics are represented. Several published portfolios, including editions of David Eugene Smith's Portraits of Eminent Mathematicians, containing prints and biographical information on the mathematicians are also included. Plates appear to often come from published works and in some cases include portions of text from the book from which they were removed.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: R. Keith Dennis Mathematician Print and Photo collection, #8565. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p:

Karl Weierstrass

Photograph by Fenner showing the attendees of the 1946 annual meetings of the American Mathematical Society, Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and Mathematical Association of America at Cornell University, photographed in front of Barton Hall.

unittitle.title: Das projektive Zeichnen nebst den für das Zeichnen wichtigsten Aufgaben aus der ebenen Geometrie

scopecontent.p: By Max Kleiber, published by Wilhelm Effenberger

unittitle.title: A Portfolio of Portraits of Eminent Mathematicians

scopecontent.p: By David Eugene Smith, published by The Open Court Publishing Company. Incomplete set, missing several pages. Includes: Pythagoras, Pierre de Fermat, Leonardo Bonacci (2 copies), Euclid, Gerolamo Cardano, Gottfried Wilhelm Liebnitz, John Napier, François Viète, Thales of Miletus, Blaise Pascal, Johann Bernoulli (2 copies), Jakob Bernoulli, Guillaume de l'Hôpital, Bonaventura Cavalieri, Gaspard Monge, Niccolo Tartaglia, Isaac Barrow (spelled Issac).

unittitle.title: Portraits of Eminent Mathematicians Portfolio Number One

scopecontent.p: By David Eugene Smith, puclished by Scripta Mathematica. Includes: Archimedes, Nicolaus Copernicus, François Viète, Galileo Galilei, John Napier, René Descartes, Isaac Newton (missing), Gottfried Wilhelm Liebnitz, Joseph-Louis Lagrange, Carl Freidrich Gauss (missing), Nikolai Lobachevsky, James Joseph Sylvester.

unittitle.title: Portraits of Eminent Mathematicians Portfolio Number Two

scopecontent.p: By David Eugene Smith, puclished by Scripta Mathematica. Includes: Euclid, Gerolamo Cardano, Johannes Kepler, Pierre de Fermat (missing), Blaise Pascal, Leonhard Euler (missing), Pierre-Simon Laplace, Augustin-Louis Cauchy, Carl Gustav Jacob Jacobi, William Rowan Hamilton, Arthur Cayley (missing), Pafnuty Chebyshev, Henri Poincaré (missing).

unittitle.title: Portraits of Eminent Mathematicians Portfolio Number Two (copy 2)

scopecontent.p: By David Eugene Smith, puclished by Scripta Mathematica. Includes: Euclid (missing), Gerolamo Cardano, Johannes Kepler, Pierre de Fermat (missing), Blaise Pascal, Leonhard Euler (missing), Pierre-Simon Laplace, Augustin-Louis Cauchy, Carl Gustav Jacob Jacobi, William Rowan Hamilton, Arthur Cayley (missing), Pafnuty Chebyshev, Henri Poincaré (missing).

unittitle.title: Portraits of Famous Philosophers who were also Mathematicians

scopecontent.p:
By Cassius Jackson Keyser, published by Scripta Mathematica
Includes: Pyhagoras, Plato, Aristotle, Epicurus, Roger Bacon, René Descartes, Blaise Pascal, Benedict Spinoza, Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz, George Berkeley, Immanuel Kant, Charles Peirce

By Henry Crew, published by Scripta Mathematica. Includes: Galileo, Christiaan Huygens, Isaac Nweton, André-Marie Ampère, Augustin Fresnel, Michael Faraday, James Prescott Joule, Rudolf Julius Emmanuel Clausius, James Clerk Maxwell, Josiah Willard Gibbs, Heinrich Rudolf Hertz, Henry Augustus Rowland.
